Role Synopsis The Trading Analytics & Insights team sits within the front office and is responsible for providing a broad range of analytical support that directly supports our energy commodities trading activity. Within Trading Analytics & Insights, the Structuring team is responsible for providing structuring support to Oil, Asia Pacific Gas & Power, Low Carbon, Global LNG businesses. An opportunity is currently available for a Structurer to join the team and provide structuring support to the commercial teams. Structurers are primarily responsible for a) working proactively with traders, originators, and business functions in analysing and developing structures, b) developing and improving valuation and hedging models of energy assets and exotic structured transactions, and c) assisting in the structuring and valuation of deals by understanding and quantifying the embedded optionality, risks, and relevant value drivers. Key Accountabilities: Physical and Financial products valuation Design and improve physical and financial products valuation models and techniques. Maintain knowledge of industry standard models and methods and calibrate models and evaluate deals. Understand models’ strengths and limitations and practical application. Communicate results to traders, origination, and other analysts Offer commercial insight into the valuation process, devising and advocating alternate deal structures to enhance value for the business. Able to defend the results and incorporate relevant feedback. Able to explain structured transactions in basic components. Work with wider commercial team and functions Develop approaches to value/assess non-standard or non-price risks imbedded in transactions on the go. Assist mid and back-office personnel in understanding of proposed deals and develop a collaborative relationship around the booking/modelling of live deals within the middle office and risk systems. Work with relevant parties to identify and quantify both market and non-market risks and assist proposing hedging and other mitigations if available. Essential Experience: Experience in quantitative / structuring / commercial roles in the gas and power market, especially in Asia Pacific or Europe. Experience in other energy market will also be considered. Exposure to deal structuring/valuation of exotic gas/power products, tolling arrangements, renewable PPAs, energy storage systems, etc. and cashflow modelling for the same. An understanding of the key elements of the value chain and key drivers setting commodity prices, spreads and non-linear product pricing. Ability to develop/ refine tools/complex models. High attention to detail to ensure robust and reliable analysis. Clear and succinct communication skills in order to explain impact on deal value of price changes (level, spreads and dynamics) as well as valuation assumptions and hedge strategies. Confidence to challenge assumptions and offer practical solutions. Good interpersonal skills to develop and maintain collaborative relationships within the structuring team as well as with stakeholders across the business. Ability to identify and prioritize potential opportunities and to act quickly and decisively. Essential Education Degree level qualification in a numerate subject (e.g. mathematics/economics/ physics/engineering or similar). Desirable Criteria Postgraduate qualification in a finance or quantitative area or CFA designation will be a plus. Desired experience in managing exposure and valuation of oil, natural gas and power physical assets, and structured transactions, such as pipelines, storage, power plants, and exotic options. Candidates with project finance experience in commodity markets with strong financial modelling skills will be considered.

Job Description Roles & Responsibilities As a Storage and Backup Engineer, your job responsibilities should cover the following: · Candidate must have minimum 5+ years of experience as project lead or project team members in one or more the highly visible and critical infrastructure projects. · Must have NAS and SAN storage experience which is mandatory. · Work with Project team to prepare project low/high level design and scope and troubleshooting of backup jobs on platforms (Oracle, SQL Server, Windows, VMware, and UNIX servers). · Analyze backup software performance and monitoring of scheduled backups to ensure success or take remedial action for failures · Configure backup policy for new backup clients. · Manage storage and backup policy changes through the change request process & provide status reports to the relevant parties. · Involve in project team for backup requirements and provide progress status update on a weekly basis. · Respond promptly to incidents, investigate & provide temporary &/or permanent resolution of incidents escalated. The ideal candidate should possess: · Degree in Computer Information system or related field · Minimum 5 years relevant working experience in storage and backup administration in large, complex environment. · Strong knowledge in Veritas Netbackup / Veeam backup / IBM Tape Library / HPE P9500, 3PAR, & XP7 / NetApp / Purestorage / EMC VPLEX, VMAX / Brocade SAN switches / MDS 9706, 9710 switch · Knowledge in Windows / Linux / UNIX / VMware / SQL databases (Oracle, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB). · Experience in tapeless a backup solution to AWS cloud is a plus. · Working experience in archiving solutions like Enterprise Vault and Vault Solution is a plus.

Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sandeep Virothu Recruiter View profile & contact The Analytics Expert provides insightful analysis of information, from a variety of sources, to key stakeholders, based on deep subject matter expertise and effective use of an extensive analytics toolkit. Job Description You will be joining the Platform Engineering team to develop and support the intraday and end-of-day pricing, risk and P&L in Kannon’s expansion across DB.  Responsibilities will include: Implementing new, automated, processes either within, or through enhancements to the bank’s strategic infrastructure or through Strat solutions. Developing solutions and controls to improve integration of the Strats application stack with the various functions across Group Analytics. Working in partnership with Trading, Structuring, Methodology, Technology and Operations to drive the build-out of the strategic analytics platforms. Skills & Qualifications The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following: Strong computing and programming skills.  The application stack has a C++ core with extensive of Python. Solid experience of infrastructure and database technologies such as MySQL, Oracle, Redis, RMDS. Relevant education such as an MSc/PhD in a subject such as Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Maths, or Finance. The ability to communicate effectively within a team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritise against tight deadlines. Experience of the above within banking or finance and an understanding of cash and derivatives financial products. Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: Group Strat Analytics builds applications that solve quantitative problems. The group’s key delivery, a project known as Kannon, is to provide a step-change improvement in the quality of Risk and PnL analysis across many functions including Rates and Credit Trading, Treasury and the Transaction Bank. This is being achieved by providing best-in-class applications and libraries for both live trading as well as end-of-day analysis. It has been funded as a Core Change Initiative at the heart of the DB’s Simplification Strategy. The design, specification and implementation of Kannon is by Strats in close partnership with Trading & Sales, Methodology, Technology and Support groups. The application covers risk analysis and live pricing tools as well as E-Trading analytics. This includes batch, real-time and desktop processing using a single cohesive architecture. The consistency in analytics and the technology platform ensures that no arbitrage can exist between various parts of the Bank as well as rational allocation of constrained resources, including risk budget, balance sheet, funding, and capital. The Platform Engineering team is responsible for the tooling that underpins multiple aspects of the Strats projects including delivering SDLC tools, Test Automation and Monitoring as well as Reference Data management and Grid compute orchestration. It also works with DB Technology groups to provision hardware estate and Control functions to address Regulation and Policy adherence. Your key responsibilities: You will be joining the Platform Engineering team to improve the processes that underpin its successful operation Design and implementation of the deployment of key infrastructure components such as database or compiler upgrades. Maintenance of high-performance applications deployed across multiple locations. Improving the stability of the development and production environments. Support development teams with infrastructure queries. Share in the support rota supporting the practical use of the application in the production environment. Your skills and experience: The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following skills: Track record of developing or supporting large applications running on Unix platforms. 2 years or more of experience with Python production level development, including experience with Numpy and Panda. 5 years or more of experience with each of: Bash script development of ancillary processes that support functions such as scheduling, backups, reporting and monitoring. C++ working on interfacing application libraries to databases or other remote sources such as MariaDB or Redis. Maintaining and implementing CI tool chaining on Team-city /Jenkins or other CI environments. Ability to communicate effectively within a technical team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritize against tight deadlines.

Job_Descriptions: VP/ Assistant VP, Category Manager, Strategic Procurement, Group Technology & Operations VP/ Assistant VP, Category Manager, Strategic Procurement, Group Technology & Operations Posting Date: 27-Jan-2022 Location: Cecil Street, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Support, define and implement category IT strategies across the Bank, working in close collaboration with IT stakeholders and business functions to deliver a structured sourcing process to optimize the value from the supply market. At the outset, proactively engage and integrate input from respective stakeholders to drive and optimize value generation. Foster effective collaboration and ensure strong communication lines with key stakeholders and colleagues in and across the countries to work towards shared business goals. Develop and strengthen long-term partnerships with key stakeholders. Develop key stakeholder matrix in each category to maintain regular engagement. Track and report savings achievements for areas in scope. Ensure compliance to UOB policies, standards/guidelines. Identify opportunities for improvement from an end-to-end perspective across Strategic Sourcing & Procurement function. Establish appropriate supplier relationship management for assigned suppliers. Job Requirements Degree from any recognised University or recognised establishment (Business, Finance, Engineering or accounting will be beneficial) Professional certifications in the field of Sourcing/Procurement/Supply Chain (e.g. CIPS, CPPM, CPM) are advantageous Minimum 7 years of relevant working experience in driving IT sourcing engagements and negotiating supplier contracts. Excellent communication (written, verbal) and interpersonal skills to positively influence people to make the appropriate decisions and resolve conflicts effectively. Performance-driven balanced with proven success of working effectively in a cross-functional team in an international environment. Process-oriented and possesses a strategic mindset with the ability to have a holistic view. Ability to deliver and articulate a presentation confidently and effectively to a wider project committee and management. Competent in formulating supplier negotiation strategies to address commercial and contractual (includes boilerplates and KPIs/SLAs) aspects. Relevant experience in the financial services industry is advantageous. Knowledge and familiarity of working with e-Sourcing tools and systems Strong project management experience Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. Job_Title: Bank Middle Office Trade Support Associate ($5000-8500)
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Ivy Tham Recruiter View profile & contact • Provide support & control to the Vanilla IRFX Business = • This role encompasses trade validation & booking in booking systems. • Coordinate compressions Key Responsibilities 1. TRADE SUPPORT •    Ensure that Rates Derivatives Vanilla are reconciled with external source (termsheets/ emails/ broker confirmations/ reuters conversation etc) and liaise with Front office to rectify discrepancies on the same day •    Ensure that deals are properly interfaced from Front Office to Middle Office and manually book the deals in Middle Office system in the event that interface is not working •    Post amendments, market events and cancellations •    Resolve queries from BO and other stakeholders •    Reconcile PV of trades between Front Office and Middle Office at the end of each day •    Account for all daily outstanding and unprocessed trades 2. FUTURES •    Ensure that brokered futures trades are reconciled with external source and rectify discrepancies on the same day •    Notify relevant parties for un-cleared futures trades sent by Paris Back Office •    Reconcile daily the Futures positions in Front Office and Back Office •    Monitor and notify Front Office on upcoming futures maturities •    Account for all unmatched Futures and highlight night/late transactions transacted 3.  COMPRESSION •    Coordinate compression with TriOptima, Capitalab, bilateral parties and etc •    Participate and roll out new compression initiatives 4. CONTROL •    Comply with internal and external regulatory and compliance requirements •    Ensure all controls are in place and reconciliations front-to-back are investigated and reconciled: i.    Emails from Back offices, Middle offices and IT are investigated ii.    Emails from Credit Risk control are investigated iii.    Abnormal Trading are investigated and accounted iv.    Ensuring trades are booked timely on trade date v.    Account for missing booking and escalate when necessary vi.    Checking of daily reports 5.  Others (for Associate and above)•    Providing solutions to new business initiatives •    Reviewing workflow and propose enhancements to improve processes •    Review controls are updated and reviewed regularly •    Providing training and guidance to junior members Job Requirements •    Minimum 3 years’ experience in IRD trade support (knowledge in Interest Rates Derivatives products (IRS, CCS, FRA, Swaption, Bond options, Futures etc)) •    Basic knowledge on VBA – Hands on experience to develop and modify Macro spreadsheet •    Murex knowledge preferred •    Responsible, meticulous, self-motivated, fast learner, positive attitude •    Possess great team spirit but yet can work independently •    Confident and possess good communication and interpersonal skills •    Highly driven, resourceful and result oriented •    Ability to work on staggered hours (9am-6pm, 11am-8pm ) •    Willing to work on public holiday on rotation basis Interested applicants please email your resume to ivytham@recruitexpress.com.sg Ivy Tham Yi Ru (R1104692) Recruit Express Pte Ltd (EA Number: 99C4599)
